review_text:
If you want night out to explore some gentle pyromania, HB has plenty of fire pits accessible. Parking is $15 on the lot, $3.5/hr on the street. 

Bring a jacket.

Huntington Beach can be a little crowded at times, but I love coming here when I am Orange County. I love the beach culture and the vibes here. I don't surf, but I like to ride my longboard on the boardwalk and float on my boogie board. Huntington Breach is a 10 mile long stretch of sandy beaches and is nicknamed "Surf City". Newport Beach is just south of this area. One of the world's largest surf competition called The US Open of Surfing takes place here in the summer. 

The waves can be a little stronge at times, but I love it. I love the workout fighting the waves and have caught some good ones on my boogie board. I like to walk on the pier and watch all of the other surfers on their boards and the sunset. Downtown Huntington Beach is pretty cool. There are lots of places to shop and eat at. I will usually pick up a few items at a surf shop and then grab some Wahoo's after a long day at the beach. They have an Artisan Fair on Fridays and occasional weekends where you can pick up some local artwork. Parking isn't too bad on the weekdays if you get here early enough. Weekends can be more challenging. 

Huntington Beach is home to the Huntington Beach International Surfing Museum. There is lots of memorabilia here if you enjoy surf history.
Honestly best beach we've been to here. It was very clean, easy parking, bathrooms, and a children's playground. It was so much fun and so very convenient.

Okay but who made it to Adrian's kickback ???? Anybody actually show up to the tik tok frenzy ? 
It was crazy ! As I was driving buy I saw many stores you could walk to - love the organization at night when vehicles have to leave
author_location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA

review_text:
Location & parking: I generally park on the street or near the neighborhoods, free and have never had an issue. The walk over to the beach is less that 5 mins. 

Vibes: Depends on the day you go and the time, the crowd can vary significantly but these last two times I've gone during the summer evenings It's been great vibes. 

Experience: Going with a group of friends and hanging near the fire pits has been a highlight of the summer season so far. Staking out a pit can be a bit of a waiting game but if you go at the right time, early evening during the week it's no issue. Even on a holiday weekend, you can wait on a group to leave and you'll be fine. The pits are spaced out enough for a group to do their own thing and have their music playing. Beach closes at 10pm and the security is pretty on it. No complaints though. I'm not too sure about the pier, promenade, or other parts of the beach since I mostly stayed near the pits but I recommend it to anyone.

Decided to take my parents to the ocean, since they've never been to the west coast. 
it was oddly PACKED and many parking lots were full. we finally spotted street parking and were able to take it just in time. 2 hours was about $7, not too bad. we were super confused as to why it was so busy and before we knew it we were in the middle of an air show! the pacific air show?? I had no idea it was going on so it was a huge surprise and success for an outing!
now we understood why it was so packed. 
even with how packed it was, we enjoyed ourselves. they had emergency vehicle "roads" marked out on the sand with caution tape, which made us feel extremely safe. pretty organized event. which there would have been more table and chairs around for my parents, we ended up having to leave before the air show ended because they were hungry but they didn't want to stand up and eat at the food trucks or the little food stands that were around. 

this is actually the second time I have randomly gone to huntington beach to find myself in the middle of the pacific air show. it was super cool and hope to one day be able to experience the entire thing, beginning to end!

As for the beaches and streets, they were pretty clean. enough police around to feel safe but not entirely overwhelmed. wish I could have taken my mom to feel the ice cold pacific water but too many people around and the way the waves had been hitting the sand, it was like a huge DIP before getting to any water.

This is one of our favorite beach spots when we come to Southern California. We love walking through the shops, eating the food, stopping at the beach bars, playing in the ocean, and just having a great time people watching, and also watching some of the best sun sets on the pier.

We came to the beach for fun in the sun The area of the beach we met at was near Main Street. Nice beach! We saw volleyball going on and there is a paved bike trail where you can ride your bike, skate or walk. The beach has paid parking and street parking. I parked in a "Public Parking" structure. Get ready for crowds! There are a lot restaurants in walking distance of the beach, bike rentals, street performers, and Farmers  Market. We came on a Tuesday so I don't know if the Farmers Market is there every day. We also saw a band playing. Main Street itself was closed for the festivities. If you don't have anything to do. Have a beach day in Huntington Beach.

Summer is almost here time to start shedding those extra pounds ( allot of shedding to do ) lol
This location is so beautiful to walk , run , bike ride or swim. Melting pot of people . Only giving it 4 stars only because it's a little more dirty then some of the beaches I've been too . But it's easily overlooked by the great views!

Just discovered Huntington Beach. I'm now a believer and will be back. It's everything I want in a beach. 
 $15 bucks to park all day, restrooms, snacks and tons of parking plus beach goes on for miles so plenty of places to sit, read and daydream while watching the waves, never feels crowded and sand is soft.

Ah, Huntington Beach, once the jewel of the SoCal coastline, now edging dangerously close to becoming "Santa Ana-by-the-Sea." My olfactory senses got a workout from the beach restrooms, which seem to double as a neglected potpourri of eau de urine and feces. Seriously, guys, would a little Windex kill ya?

The path to the beach is less a path and more a test of your strength and determination. Asphalt? Don't make me laugh. Be prepared for a "Survivor" episode as you lug your cooler, umbrella, and dignity across the sandy Sahara they call a beach.

And let's not forget the local characters. Ah yes, there's a peculiar breed of motorists here waving American flags out their windows, stuck in some kind of political time warp. It's like "Back to the Future," only Marty McFly is nowhere to be found to fix the DeLorean.

Come for the ocean, stay for the circus!

Awesome local southern California beach. Clean. Lots of activities,  shops and restaurants.
You can see surfers & paragliding often.

The fajitas are amazing! We go there often and always a great experience. 
Brian the server is always on point! Maris the bartender is above and beyond. I'm so glad they opened one in my area. Never disappointed and the ambiance is so fun and classy. 
Thanks for being awesome!!!
Good place for photos and many more things to do here parking not that bad good place to walk as well

Alan's Clean-Up & Hauling  is a great  company to use to both move your belongings and to haul off junk!
Alan is super nice, very reasonably priced, reliable, quick and very careful. His assistant Ryan is a hard worker and very nice, too!
I'm from Texas and had to make the arrangements long distance. I called 5 different Moving/hauling companies and I'm so happy I chose Alan!
310-625-4285 Give him a call!!
Huntington Beach and Pier is so beautiful to walk , run , surf or swim. It is great place to people watch, especially the surfers. There are several places to grab a bite and walk the pier.

Love this place.  Parking $20 fee one time entry.  Go get everything you need before you get there.  I bought everything in my cooler and bags.  Just chilled for hours and hours.  Reapply sun block and hydrated.  I enjoyed the breeze, our spot, and the other fellow beach goers.

My favorite beach for bonfires! The pits are next to the parking lot so you don't have to lug all your stuff to the edge of the water. While it'd be nice to be by the water, this makes for an easy clean up and pack up situation. Embarrassing to say but I can't swim, the the waves here are rather intimidating. Parking lot day use parking is $20 as of July 2022. there is also metered parking. And if you're patient and don't mind a walk, you can also park in the neighborhoods nearby. Main Street and the pier are right there if you want to grab a bite before, during, or after your beach visit. West coast sunsets are pretty great.  Beach closes at 10pm.

Huntington Beach is a beachgoer's paradise. With beautiful white sand and a seemingly endless stretch of beach, it is the perfect place for a full day experience.

The day started by relaxing on the beach, surrounded by miles of picturesque blue Pacific Ocean waters. The sun shone brightly, and the waves provided a calming musical accompaniment. The beach was the perfect place to indulge in activities such as sunbathing, swimming, surfing, and volleyball. As the day progressed, the beachgoers indulged in a variety of activities such as beachcombing, kite flying, and enjoying the beach's local wildlife.

In the afternoon, the beach was host to a number of events, including a beach bonfire, fireworks show, and a beach barbeque. Beachgoers were also able to enjoy music and entertainment provided by local vendors. The evening was filled with laughter and camaraderie, and it was the perfect way to end a perfect day.

After a full day of activities and entertainment, many of the beachgoers enjoyed a delicious dinner at one of the many restaurants located along the pier. The quality of the food was second to none, and it was the perfect way to cap off a full day experience at Huntington Beach.

In conclusion, a full day experience at Huntington Beach is one that will not be soon forgotten. With its beautiful white sand and miles of pristine ocean waters, Huntington Beach offered the perfect setting for a perfect day. Whether spending time relaxing on the beach, indulging in various beach activities, attending an event, or dining along the pier, Huntington Beach guaranteed an unforgettable full day experience.

One of the best beaches to relax and splash in the waves. Parking is easy and costs $15 / day. Close proximity to the restrooms and fire pits. Not as crowded the farther away you are from the pier with enough spacing between people.

I'm not sure why there are 3 different Huntington Beach (HB) on Yelp. But here we go again.

HB is a fabulous beach. I don't visit it very often because I don't live close by it. When I am here, it's always a pleasant visit. It's a pretty clean beach. Lots of people walking around, riding bikes, just chilling. They say "Life's a beach". I need to get out to the beach more often than not... I love the fresh crisp air, the open breeze, smooth winds... makes me want to go to the beach right now LOL.

Well, I'll plan for a weekend at the garden + HB before this summer ends. Thanks for the inspiration! See you there! Happy HB'ing!

The city beach has this stretch of sand sits along the PCH between Goldenwest St. and Beach Blvd, where professional surfers surf while you catch some sun exposure. There are volleyball courts, bonfire pits, and the iconic spanning pier, where visitors and locals like to experience the soft ocean breeze and the sounds of crashing waves. The sunset view is breathtaking and indescribable in words.

It is easy to park. Three hours cost us about five dollars. There is a shower to rinse off after a dip in the Pacific. It is also fun to walk the pier. The bathrooms are disgusting. I recommend only using them as an emergency. 

We had a great day!

Everywhere you go in the United States there are beaches That reflect that part of the country. I've been fortunate to sample most of them over time. All have pros and cons but everyone has their favorite. Mine happens to be on the Texas coast because that's the one that gives me a sense of place with family during the summers growing up. Not the most esthetically pleasing to some but, still the ocean!

I had never experienced these beautiful wide SoCal beaches until I saw Huntington on my first trip here as an adult! I couldn't believe I've missed out on these big wide expansive beauties. Hopefully, I get a chance to go back before the final curtain!

You can never have too much fun in Huntington Beach. Especially if you live out here in which now i have made new friends out here living next door to Fountain Valley. People from all over the globe come to Huntington Beach for fun, Surfing, Drinking , Partying, and enjoying some of the best restaurants and entertainment the city has to offer. Everyday the city try and put up something nice for the community and outsiders to enjoy. I am here mostly in the Spring and Summer time.

I was on the Huntington Beach pier and I have never seen it so deserted, Tuesday is the farmers market n street fair, Main Street was like ghost town, black bull, my favorite restaurant w its phenomenal ayce Sunday brunch closed last year and Gallagher, an Irish pub went out of business last week. Life and livelihoods were destroyed by all this Fear mongering. This new variant omicron was discovered by the chair of the SouthAfrican Medical Association, Dr AngeliqueCoetzee. Here's how she describes the threat:  Looking at the mildness of the symptoms that we are seeing, currently, there's no reason for panicking as we don't see severely ill patients. 
Its gunna be good....for business !
"Product sales from its coronavirus vaccine accounted for $4.81 billion of Moderna's $4.97 billion in revenue in the third quarter."
you should not extrapolate how this variant will effect the entire population based on the opinion of the CEO for the company that stands to make billions more on booster shots for this variant. I would actually listen to Dr Coetzee that has been treating patients over the CEO who has a vested interest in extending profits for stockholders.
Viruses sometimes mutate to a less virulent strain. 
Stop with the gloom and doom.  All these articles are causing unnecessary mental illness of fear, anxiety, paranoia. So the company with over 90 percent of its revenue from covidvaccines says we need another vaccine variant to combat the new strain? It's heartbreaking to see all empty stores in my beloved hometown, these stores will never come back until Brandon is gone, I miss the vibrant city that is called Surf City. The excitement that temporarily came to HB from the skating rink unfortunately would only last till the new year I was told, the virus became endemic n people just need to learn to live with it, I have been to 2 cruises n had a blast as everything is 50% off, I'm still here! Folks please live your life and help bring HB back to its former glory.

It is my backyard so to speak. I wouldn't live anywhere else. I am a So Cal Kid who grew up in San Diego. Went to college in Los Angeles and my career brought me to Orange County. What I never knew was I would live, work, and play in Huntington Beach and LOVE IT!
The weather is always nice. Everyone from the IE & LA flocks here rain or shine. We are a community of singles, families and young families. Safe to say all locals are all dog lovers. 
Our beaches are clean and we want to keep them that way. So anything you bring (bbq, cooler, couch, umbrella, cigarettes, cans, trash, dog poop, etc) please take back with you or use the proper trash reciprocals. Don't leave it in the sand. It makes for eye sores and really pisses us locals off.
Parking is easy and plenty. Unless you go to dog beach. Those parking lots are small and few. Parking comes at a cost. Both state and city beaches. $15-$20 all day, cash only. 
If you are going to take your bike like your motorized bike. Be aware children and dogs will jump out in front of you. Go the speed limit and don't be a dick on the bikes. And don't take them on the beach. Especially Dog beach! Their not allowed for one. And two you will run over a dog. I've seen it happen. So don't do it.
All we ask when you visit that you enjoy it and respect our beaches and city.

There is no way to escape the crowds during the peak parts of the year and yes you have to pay for parking, but tis typical of any popular California beach. This is a great location to watch surfers, kids running in the ocean and kite flyers while listening to buskers. My husband purposed to me on this beach 4/28/2016. The first hotel we stayed at together was The Hyatt on HuntingtonBeach. In general really great memories here

This is for Liv! She worked the parking booth , im not sure which but it was close to Tower 3. She was super kind, very helpful and made my day 10x better. If you're reading this, thank you  (with rizz)

A beautiful beach ! It was crowded during the last weekend of August. But there was still plenty of spots to spread out. We enjoyed the water and kite flying. We felt safe in and out of the water with the guards on hand. The loss of a star was due the bathrooms. Make sure to bring your own toilet tissue or wipes. Otherwise, a lovely day and beautiful sunset.

Huntington Beach located in Orange County, California is a phenomenal beach to go to and soak up that beautiful California sun and lovely cool breezes!

Right adjacent to the beach also lays Seal Beach and from the horizon you can see Long Beach in the distance. The parking can be a bit hectic and crowded but if you patiently wait you will find a spot. Where we parked at it was a small fee and you just pay by card and put the receipt on your dashboard. The beach is full of skateboarders, runners and walkers enjoying  nature on the sidewalk along the beach. The water is very clear and blue and you cant beat the waves here if you enjoy surfing. The sand is white and luscious and it feels great to walk barefooted in the sand with the sun shining down on it. They have restrooms provided as well as wash stations to get all the sand off your body. While we were here we noticed a lot of oil rigs and cargo ships deep back into the ocean water. Down farther before the pier is the dog beach where this is Heaven for all dogs! The dogs run free and enjoy swimming and playing catch or Frisbee.  If your a dog lover and you want your furry friend to enjoy a nice day I recommend you to take them to the dog beach. 

Overall outstanding beach where your family and friends will have an amazing day out in the sun. Just make sure you bring some sunblock and water and try and get there early to avoid all the waiting for parking. Surfs Up!

The vibes at Huntington Beach are immaculate which is why it's one of my favorite beaches in OC. With metered parking spaces in a lot or street parking, I've rarely ever had an issue in finding a spot. My friends & I love this beach because no matter what you feel like doing: surfing, biking/skating on the path, eating/drinking at the restaurants or bars across the street, shopping at Pacific City, entertainment with live music, or just taking a long walk by the water or pier - there is ALWAYS something for everybody to do. Not to mention, having a bonfire at sunset to end a great day will always be top 3 best things.
Beautiful and clean beach. Large waves and beautiful sunsets. Nice bike and pedestrian paths.

Parking: Large city parking lot that is connected from Beach Blvd all the way down to close to Main St. $15 per car (as of 6/20/20). No re-entry. Also plenty of metered parking, but that can fill up quickly on holiday weekends.

Beach: Water is cool during summer and cold during winter. There's a large area of sand from the parking lot to the water which gives everyone plenty of space to set up their beach umbrellas, chair, and mats. Perfect for summer days and walks along the beach. Waves can be variable.

Sand: The sand is soft and clean. Perfect for playing sports on the beach and for kids to play in the sand. It can get hot so be sure to have your sandals ready.

Extras: Bonfire pits are available on a first come first serve basis. There's also areas to rinse off (shower style). Bathrooms are available, but I try to avoid it.

Just an ad on here that Huntington Beach area is pretty much maskless including restaurants and servers.
 We were up here for the WSA contest for all ages in different Heats.
My son was an active Pro Surfer in school and won many trophies.
At age 46 he thought he'd start again.
He is very healthy and athletic an wanted to do something that he loved so much 20 years ago.
He signed up for three Heats and walked out with two trophies coming in 5th place.
There are only trophies for up to 6th Place and a lot of competitors and a lot of competitors way younger
KUDO'S my joy!
The waves were terrible as in lots of foam, quick breaking and barely three feet.
I'm not making excuses, it was what it was. I spoke to different Surfers on the beach no one was happy about the waves.
The weather was cloudy, cold and windy most of the day until after 2.
I spent half of the time walking around downtown which is only six blocks away.
I was so happy to just spend time with my son for a couple of days and night first time since our trip to Spain.
Hope you enjoy the photos!

If your not from California this is one of the city's you need to visit.

From the beach to the shopping this is California.

Your find great places to eat on Main Street and a few fun bars 

The pier is a good place to check out the city and the surfer's

You'll need to pay for parking and there are a few parking structures so parking is easy to find most times.

Everyone I've talked to seems to really like this beach. It's dog friendly and has plenty of meter parking. We enjoyed our time here and it sure did have a stunning sunset. The sand isn't super soft. It's the more grainy kind. Waves are a bit strong here. I like the palm trees lining the walking pathway along the beach. The view towards the pier is also nice.

This place is quite nice but the main problem would be the parking. Parking really needs to be fixed when you're in the area. It's really difficult. This is the main reason I haven't come to this place in a few years.

Great job to the four City Council members who are discerning enough to ban the mask and vax mandates recently. They tried to fearmonger us once already in 2020 -- like The Who says: we won't be fooled again!!

This beach in my opinion is superior to other beaches. I drove an hour just to come and have a bonfire with my friends. If you plan on having a bonfire, come to Huntington, it is so easy. We drove into the lot, paid the $15 all-day parking fee, chose a bonfire, and started. The people there are super friendly and social! You do not need a reservation for the bonfires, though some people get there very early. The beach is also much cleaner compared to some other ones I have been to!

We came here during sunset and it was absolutely gorgeous! Seeing the beach with the boardwalk was photo worthy to frame!
We saw a ton of surfers and people just taking photos of the scenery. 
The drive to get to the beach made it all that much better by seeing all these beautiful homes!
Parking was easy and making your way to the beach was simple. Would love to visit again!

We decided to drive the Pacific Coast Highway on our way back. Huntington Beach was our first stop. There were plenty of parking spots along the street on a Friday afternoon. Just be sure to feed the meter. 

I've always loved the beach. I find the sounds of the water so soothing. It's a good place to clear your head or soak in the sun. January is a cooler month so there were not many people in the water. The beaches were clean. A must see to enjoy some fun in the sun.

The iconic Surf City. It's a great, clean beach. Parking is $15/all day but there's also street metered parking, $2/hr. We normally just rent some bikes to ride up and down the beach. I noticed they recently added fire pits. Don't recall these a few years ago. The beach was pretty empty. Maybe covid-related or because it's mid-September?
This is the best place for a day full of fun. Bring your own entertainment or rent some! Lots of great food and a place down a ways for your pups to play!

Horrible place to live! Rents are insane, downtown is a drunken mess, heroin needles on their beaches!! I've grown up here and it's now a sad place to dwell. Enjoy the pic of the heroin needle (one of many) I found near PCH and sea point.

Huntington Beach aka "Surf City USA" is one of my favorite beaches in Southern California. The beach itself is very beautiful during the day and romantic at night. The beach is clean considering the large number of people who visit daily.

On Main Street, you'll find a great selection of retail shops, outdoor dining and hotels. During this COVID-19 era, the back part of Main Street is closed off for outdoor dining. Face coverings are required but not enforced. 

If plan a trip to Southern California, I highly recommend adding Huntington Beach to your itinerary. It's great place for shopping, to grab a bite to drink/eat and catch some waves + a gorgeous sunset. The beach closes at 10PM.

Out of all the costal beaches this is my least favorite. Way overpriced w everything, parking is ridiculous, n expensive. The waves are great for surfers, but if ur looking for a place to let ur kids go swimming....not the place at all. 
They close the pier down every night n the parking lots. So make sure you know times, n pay for parking you'll get a ticket.

We visited w/a coworker who lives nearby and it was a cool experience. They always talk about California beaches so it was nice to actually be in the moment of the blaring sun in your face, sipping on some margaritas. LOL. I actually don't like the sun, sorry no it's not for me but I did it. Bonus, we saw a dead seal on the beach which was pretty cool cause it's face was missing and people playing vollyball in front of it. It wasn't as packed as I thought it would be. The only real idea I have of this beach was playing GTAV (thanks RockStar for giving me that experiece LOL). Water was cold AF and people had a lot of dogs, one of them that was the same breed as my dog back home got to gimme kisses which was a bonus cause I missed her so much (sad).

So I am NOT a beach person at all, much less an outdoorsy type. However, the rona has forced me to explore my surroundings and embrace all of what is out there. Came out here to hang with a friend and her kids for the day. 
This beach is HUGE and there is a parking lot big enough to accommodate the influx of people coming and going. $15 to park in the lot for the whole day, not bad imo. I have to say I love that the bike path here is big and wide so if you're riding along, you're not all cramped bumping into people or trying to avoid hitting them. Didn't rent bikes this time, but plan to next time. The fire pits are a nice touch to end your beach day. Don't forget your lighter fluid and smores stuff!
For the most part, it seems clean and people were social distancing within their groups. It's OC, so I didn't see a lot of people wearing masks. The bathrooms are nasty af plain and simple. I strongly advise you to hold your breath for as long as you can while you go unless you're able to stomach the stench. Every stall is disgusting and idk why but all the seats I saw were wet as if the guys just don't aim and pee all over them on purpose. WTF?! I didn't see any sinks to wash your hands so your best bet is to maybe use the showers they have to rinse your hands off. If you're a lady, bring wipes...LOTS of them and stuff them in your top so you can try to avoid touching the door when you're done handling your biz. There are paper towel holders but always empty. Hand sanitizer is always a plus! 
I didn't bring anything to eat, just drinks, so I walked over to the concession stand by the bathrooms and ordered chicken strips and a tuna sandwich. The girl was nice enough to accommodate my keto lifestyle by offering a lettuce wrapped sandwich when I asked if they could make it open faced. Yay! That was nice of her. Service was quick and they seemed to have the place spic and span!
Overall, I can't believe I'm actually saying this but I LIKE THIS BEACH and will return again!!

Surf City USA!

Huntington beach is famous and it's known as one of the best surfing beaches.

But, it's way more than that. You can view almost anything along this beach on and off it. Freaks and geeks. Athletes and artists. Musicians and jugglers. Shopping, eateries, and locals joints. Bars and hotels. All kinds of people watching and entertainment.

Plenty of parking all around for a daily fee.

You can even set up you BBQ here on the beach and have a giant tailgate party. We saw so many "tent cities" set up and some were pretty elaborate. The beach scene here on the weekends is such a part of the local community life, and it looks like they live for it when Friday rolls around.

I know if I lived out here I would too. It's a pretty cool beach.

their  is a person that stays in the pier that does magic ,
I passed by today after walking  at the pier he asked me do u want  magic ? 

I was rushing to work I said no , he got mad 
said I have bad aditude,
becouse I said no

It is self evident that the First, Fourth, and Fourteenth amendments are alive, and well in the California Sun. 

It's beautiful to see Californians exercising their rights by peacefully protesting at Huntington Beach! Bravo California Patriots! Paint the State Red! #VoteRedtosaveAmerica #FightforyourRIGHTS #FightforFREEDOM 

One of our all time fav California beaches. We love to visit Beautiful Huntington Beach as often as possible! 

Governor Newsome doesn't own the beaches. It's a public right for Californians to have access to the beaches which was mandated. 

Straight from the Department of Justice website it reads: 

"Law enforcement may not arrest, threaten or intimidate citizens exercising their right to peacefully assemble" so enjoy that California Sunshine! Humans need clean fresh air not "masks." 

It's always a beach day at Huntington Beach! 

Highly Recommend.

The wife and I are really enjoying this beach. It is about an hour away from where we live and it has everything we look for in a Southern California beach. Clean, plenty of decent restrooms, jogging/bicycle trail, tons of local and franchise business nearby, $2 per hour parking if you park by the coin or C/C meters, and also parking lots are available. The northern side of the beach has some nasty restrooms thou. I want to say around lifeguard tower 19 and above is when the rest rooms start getting smaller and unkept.

I've come here in the day or night and it's honestly such a chill beach. You def get different vibes coming in the day (busy traffic tons of people many shopping and restaurant places open) and at night (relaxing night surfers fisherman soft waves) 

you do have to pay for parking and there's beach site parking and parking in the shopping structures too where you can easily walk over . Great place to come with family,friends, or even a date!

Beautiful beach, restroom's are horrible! That's the reason why the city of Huntington Beach gets 3 stars! There is urine puddles in the stalls. Very foul smell, I called the city to report the issue to the city clerk! 

Parking was 8 bucks... all in all it was a beauty except for the bathrooms!
Very beautiful beach. Very wide and very long plenty of room for lots of people. The piers are beautiful lots of gift shops and beach front restaurants.

So we usually spend most of our time in ocean beach San Diego, we decided to take a ride to Huntington Beach and I must say I love this beach  it's a lot more wide open  with parking and beach area with your family and super clean.

We came here during a hot summer weekend. Most people got there early, so if you come late in the afternoon; be prepared to park far or even park at the pacific city (yes a lot of money) for a spot. We had some commitments in the morning, so we could not make it earlier to meet with our family...anyways, it's very crowded and the bathroom situation was really really bad!!! No toilet paper at all, very wet floor and pees half way in the toilet bowls and still long line...I know it's a public bathrooms at the beach, but you would think someone at least could refill the toilet paper and such...

Repair cost down from $ 6790.75 to $ 569.00
Took my car to 6 different repair shops
To find one honest shop
Shop # 1
he wasn't sure bud suggested two back strut
Verbally cost $ 4 to 5k

Shop #2 Dealer
Advising replacing deferent part one of them Strut $ 2,879.30 total cost
$ 6,600 I pulled the car out after 9 days paid $ 300 for Diagnostic cost

Shop # 3 Sonia 
Ed suggested to take it to Mario TOPLINE good shop 

Shop #4  Manager Jush,
After 6 hours he didn't have the system to figure out where the problem is and suggested to take it to The shop that has a $ 40k system called
Professional Level Scanner, that detect and pinpoint the bad part,
Shop #5
After 7 hours, the Professional Level Scanner system, result as follows:
ABC active body control FAULT 2 : code C1525-1 Left front critical vehicle lLevel,
C1525-8, Right rear critical vehicle level, this is likely due to internal leakage
In the check valve the front (y36/1) or rear (y36/2) axel valve blocks
The respective valve block must be replaced with revised part
estimate repair cost $ 6,790.75

Welcome to Surf City USA!

Grab your beach cruiser, flip-flops, and sunscreen - we have a lot of beach to explore! 

Not only does Huntington have an abundance of white sandy beaches, there is also a ton to do in the local area. Along the pier there are bathrooms, diners, shops, and often outdoor swap meets. The beach provides open volleyball courts and fire pits that are first-come first-serve - so arrive early!

Downtown is minutes away, where you'll find tons of local surf shops, great bars, and some pretty tasty food! Huntington has an awesome mix of both local and chain businesses, so you're sure to find something to fit any craving. 

There is a trail along the beach populated by cyclists, dog walkers, skaters, and everything in between. While this beach is best known for hosting the US Open, it also has a variety of year round food and lifestyle festivals. 

Further down PCH is the dog beach, where your pups are welcome to roam the sand off-leash. 

There's something for everyone, let the adventure begin!

Huntington Beach ale house was an amazing way to spend Veterans Day or any day for that matter. Family , pet and people friendly highly recommend ale house for lunch dinner or just a quick bite and a beer . My kids were very pleased with the s'mores, and the kid menu was very grown up they felt special and just wanted to say thank you for the experience jim. Live peace and good vibe's.

So was at Surf City, USA, for the fireworks and July 4th celebrations. Very crowded, but gorgeous day, great fireworks show, and beautiful view. Only negative - Huntington Beach, please correct this next year. Need more portapotties. As in, like 5-10 more by the pier. By the end of the day, they were nearly unusable, and then what's the point? You end up dirtying the beach more. Parking was a challenge, as to be expected. Go early, and plan to stay or go home.

Huntington vs Santa Monica, Huntington is by far the best of the two beaches. 

Parking costs $15 in the lot right in front of the beach. Usually really easy to find parking if you are their early.

Fire pits are first come, you definitely need to be there early if you want on for the night. I love doing hot dogs and smores on the pits at night. 

Water is pretty clean. The beach itself is also clean. Lots of open space to play football and fly a kite. Ton of volleyball courts. Lots of things you can do here.

I came here for 4th of July a few times. You have to come super early, like 6-7 am to get a good spot. Parking lots fill up super fast. There is a ton of traffic, you will move snail pace. Leaving the parking lot after the show is bananas. Crazy bottle neck, expect to wait 15-30 minutes to just exit. The show itself is a good 10+ minute show.
Such a gorgeous beach. Clean and good people at the beach. The surrounding area has shops and restaurants for tourists. The people are sweet and kind.

I loved this beach. It has a long side walk one could ride a bike on. There are fire pits that families were using to seat around during the sunset. The waves were great and not too rough so it is totally swimmable. The restrooms were clean and toilet paper was available.  The shower rinse outs are outside. Plenty of sand to run around on and is a pretty long beach. 

The parking is $15dlls per car. I didnt like that cause we were only there to watch the susnet and there was no other option to park but if I was to spens the entire day there then I would not mind paying.

This is my new favorite restaurant in HB. 
Green Olive on Beach. A must try!
Everything on the menu is awesome!
Greg Miller

Every year, my extended family has a family reunion lobster bake here at Huntington Beach- the first entrance off of Brookhurst, right by the bathrooms. It's $15/car to park here, which is a bit steep, but the beach is clean, the bathrooms aren't bad, and there are lifeguards. Plus, this particular beach is open til 10PM.

There's a huge expanse of sand for everything from playing volleyball to building castles or just taking a nap. Bring a grill or hit up the snack bar for eats, but don't bring glass bottles. Dispose of your trash in designated receptacles or take it with you.

The water is usually pretty calm here, and there are several events that take place on this beach- art fairs, surfing contests, kiting groups, and concerts, to name a few. Note that the further you go down towards the pier, the busier it tends to get.

It's a great beach. Not too crowded and no seagulls messing around. Clean beach with cold water. Good view too.
The pier is nice but not all that unique at the end.

HB will always have a special place in my heart....
There are so many great memories from past to present.  I feel lucky to live in OC where a short drive down PCH will give you a gorgeous scenic view of 3-4 beaches.  HB has been my #1 to chill on the sand and soak up the sun or to capture the sunset. A walk on the pier has a calming affect when you want to de-stress. 

HB is known as "Surf City".  Here you'll find many camping out in their trailers, fishing on the pier, swimming, biking, exercising and other beach activities.  At dusk, many gather out here for bonfires.  It's gets super crowded during the summer months because more tourists visit the area. 

You can park at one of the lots off PCH.  I prefer to utilize the metered parking along the street.  I LOVE HB and come here a few times a month!!  After a beach day, you can cross the street to Pacific City where you can go shopping or dine at the many restaurants with the oceanfront view.

Love this beach!  My favorite since it's a long stretch of beach and you can walk.  Seaweed is not bad here either or they actually pick it up.  Parking is in the lots or street meters.   

Love the section near Pacific City since you can walk across the street for good food and clean bathrooms.   

I take all my visitors here!

Huntington Beach or Newport Beach?  My coworker who lived in Irvine for 14 years swears by NB, but since we've never been to HB, we decided to give it a try.

HB in my humble opinion is more laid back, more casual and not too many fancy restaurants like NB.  Also, NB is old money, so houses are mammoth over there.  Here in HB, it's mostly businesses and surprisingly, quite a few chains like Starbucks, The Coffee Bean and even BJ.  The main action is right on Main Street (about 4 blocks), and every Tuesday from 5-9pm, they have Tacos Tuesday and Farmer's Market.  The nice part is that most restaurants do offer outdoor seating (with heater) which is great for us pet owners so they could dine with us too!  In terms of beach and view, I much prefer Venice Beach or Malibu.  There is much more excitement there, but if you prefer to just chill, this might be an optional spot for you.

Until then, be kind to one another and Cheers! ~ :p

I've been coming to this beach since I was a kid.  I usually just park on the street with the metered parking ($1.75/hr). The beach is big, with most people near the pier. It kind of fades out the further away you are from the pier. It's nice that there are fire pits available for use. They are a first come first serve basis. 

Sometimes I just pack a sandwich and come eat it on the shore. It's not as beautiful as some other beaches in CA (ex. laguna) but it's close and it's the beach. Plus, the waves are better here than they are at laguna!

Can you think of a more pure place to say I do? The waves breaking in the background, soft sand beneath your toes, and nature's cool breeze brushing against you. This beach holds a lot of memories for many people, and for our couple we shot here for their elopement, the same will be true. Every beatiful moment deserves a beautiful setting.
"Life is a beach, I'm just playin' in the sand" - Lil' Wayne

Visiting my friends I said I want a Cali beach day and they delivered!  For all those East coast folk reading this here are the main differences I found from our beaches:

1. Longer walk from the parking lot to the water- lots of sand!
2. The waves are stronger
3. The water is saltier
4. The food is more expensive ($6 for a small bag of dipping dots!)
5. That sun is stronger
6. Single individual room bathrooms make for tighter changing quarters and stinkier!
7. Super cool that the back of the beach is lined with fire pits!


With it being a Friday in July I was anticipating a lot more people.  There were people.  My friends set a table near a fire pit early in the morning so at 6ish we moved from water front to fire pit.  We spent the whole day at the beach! It was really cool at night when every fire pit was occupied, people were making friends between groups but you also had your own private party happening at each fire pit.  I loved this!  Overall, a great place to boogie board and have dinner on the fire!  But you have to be out by 10pm.

Awesome beach, love coming here, came this time with some colleagues and we had a little work fam evening, drank a lot of beet and liquor and swam a lot, the water was so nice and clean, the life guard was sexy, can't lie. 
All and all was a great evening.

Beautiful as always. Lots of parking. Groups are spacing out and respecting boundaries. Was surprised to see dogs on the beach south of the pier near lifeguard stand 9. Some walking on leashes on the shore and others on leashes at the beach with their owners. Is this something new? I thought there was a dog beach.

I've been to many beaches in California and never had a problem until this Sunday when my friend and I received a parking citation even after we paid for a day use pass for $15.00! The parking fees are $15.00 for an all day pass with an attendant or $1.50 an hour at the meters. 

Besides the shitty parking citation, I love this beach! Has a promenade shopping plaza across the street and has an awesome pier. If you walk all the way down the boardwalk there is a diner called Rubys and also amazing 360 views. 

Also, bonfires are allowed at this beach! Perfect for night time. The beach doesn't close until 10pm

This is probably the most popular spot in LA/OC to hang out at the beach, grill and do bonfires. Which is what I dont like about it during the summer, just way too many people. It's a massive beach with tons of room and firepits...... except for the summer time. Plan on getting here by 6-7am to reserve a pit or you won't get one at all. 

With that said, It's a nice beach and great for people watching and there's lots of amenities, you can rent everything from umbrellas to bikes and surfboards. If you dont mind the people, then this place is great.

I prefer coming here to do bonfires in the winter! Sure it's cold, but its never crowded, plenty of fire pits, no drama. The police are chill and aren't trying to immediately kick you off the beach as soon as its ten. Also you'll have enough time to actually enjoy a bonfire. During the summer it starts getting dark at like 8pm.... so you have like 2 hours to burn your wood. Bring a jacket.... cause it gets cold unless you've got a big fire. 

3 stars in summer time for bonfires (there's nicer beaches to go to)
5 stars for winter bonfires

It is very easy to parking. Huntington Beach is beautiful, it is definitely my favorite place in California. We went to there around 1 PM, it was busy and hot. cost us few dollar, i really loved it. We loved this place!

After grabbing dinner at one of the nearby eateries, my friend and I took some time to stroll around the beach's paved walkways with her toddler in tow (and by in tow I mean racing ahead, as 2 year olds do). I really loved the energy in this area - lots of sunbathers, families, skateboarders, runners - action galore! 

Plus, the fire pits smelled AMAZING, especially mixed with that ocean air. Though I'm not a surfer myself, it's cool to see that this is a destination for lotsssss of surfing action. So jealous my friend lives so close by - I'd be here every day!

We love this beach. Clean, nice waves and easy access. Haven't had a bad experience yet but be careful of rip currents, happens a lot. Let's keep it clean so people can all enjoy this great escape from the summer heat. It's busy year round and biking path is great way to get fresh air during covid season.

Surf City USA is one of the most iconic beaches in the USA, especially the pier. If you head across the street from the pier you can observe the Duke statue, the Hawaiian man who is responsible for bringing surfing to the the USA. There's nothing like working up a good sweat on the beach, volleyball, and surfing, and most importantly a late night bon fire with friends and family.

I used to live in Huntington Beach for about 15 years recently moved away came back to visit after one summer away. Wow times are changing in Huntington. It's definitely not the same anymore. It's becoming really trashy and full of homeless and druggies, when we parked our car in the parking lot at the beach there was a bunch of young kids hanging out in the parking lot drinking. I could tell it was not very safe environment for my family. I did not feel comfortable parking there. The beach was full of people you could tell that we're not from Huntington. The vibes have really changed. It's turning into Venice. It's just going downhill. Considering all the million dollar homes you would think that they would implement more standards for their community. I just see Huntington becoming worse as the years go on. t's just not the same anymore. It makes me really sad because at one time Huntington Beach was one of the cleanest and nicest beaches along the coast.

Huntington Beach is open until 10 pm every night. During June/July the longest days of the year it is light until 8.30ish the max.

It cost 15 a day to park at the beach.  They use this money to clean the beach and restrooms and lifeguard salaries.  So if you look at it that way, it is not so bad.

If you get hungry, they have a 4 block restaurant bar district, Main Street,  which has all kinds of food.  Its expensive because rents in this area are extreme.   They have to make most of their money during summer months. 

Don't worry that they don't allow alcohol on the beach, there are tons of open air bars on main street to drink the day and night away away with shirtless guys and bikini clad women spring break style.  This way if the alcohol helps you to meet someone for the night, there are no surprises when you get back home like when you forget to check your eggs at Ralphs.

And if you are married or attached, just ask them to use those special sun glasses that puts clothing on anyone with a swimsuit and you will not get whiplash. 

There are no pets or smoking allowed on the beach.  The pit fires they allow on the beach make enough smoke to fumigate and kill you.

Nudity is no longer permitted on the beach but feel free to bring your thong if you like attention.

It costs 30 to 35 to rent a bike daily.  The bike path goes on forever and ever in both directions.   Its nice. 

HB is a fun place.  Its the epicenter of beach life in So Cal so check it out.  Get a tee shirt that says "I survived a day at HB" to show the non-adventourous relatives and friends. 

See you on the bike path!
Adrian's Kickback was lit, happened at Tower 13, I wouldn't be surprised if it's made into a movie

I should have taken photos!

This place was so nice and I found it easy to park with my elderly pops. 

Small beach but usually full of people. 

Life Guard was on duty and no dogs allowed during certain hours.

We took our daughter to the Disney Theme Parks for her 5th birthday but decided to take a break over the weekend to avoid the larger crowds.

Huntington Beach was our Saturday destination and we enjoyed walking along the bike trail from the parking lot to the pier.

By the way, you can save $5 parking in the city lot as opposed to the state lot.

I love Huntington Beach. It's beautiful, clean and most importantly has the fire pits!! It's great location to be able just to cross the street and go get some food, coffee or anything you need within walking distance!! Parking is not bad either.
This beach is amazing to bring your kids along and interact with all kinds of puppy dogs. It literally doggie beach paradise. If you are driving from far away it is worth the drive.

I've been coming here for years and it's a great beach to take out of towners who want to lay on the beach and see the pier, catch a surfing competition, volleyball competition, kite flying, etc. Parking is $15 all day. You can park the car here and walk around Main Street or on PCH. It's only a 25-30 minute drive from my place. 

It's a nice area to get out to. The traffic isn't too bad especially if you take the 22 to Beach Blvd. exit. Than taking the 5 to the 55 freeway and taking PCH all the way up for a more scenic route but you'll be dealing with a lot of traffic getting into Newport Beach. 

The weather was so nice last Sunday.

There is so much space here! Came on a Thursday on Memorial Day weekend and it was empty. Would have to try coming on a weekend day and see how packed it is. The sand is definitely more coarse than typical but still great. Would definitely come back. Lots of great restaurants and shops to walk to.

3 ladies in Anaheim for a conference and decided to go to the beach the day before we left.  Rented a car and the drive was less than an hour.  Great little beach town!  Ample restaurants to pick from (we got coffee at 602 and burritos from Sanchos.  Took everything down to the beach and put our feet in the sand, soaked up some sun, and had a great beach day.   Parking was less than $10 for a couple hours and it was easy to find a spot on a Sunday in April.  The only downside - public bathrooms were horrendous!  Hold it!  haha

I always come to this beach with my family! We don't like staying next to the pier cause it's to crowded. I did go with my friends close to the pier and it was a bit crowded. Someone told me this place is rocky didn't believe it till my next visit it sure is. The waves are more dangerous in California then Florida. The water is super cold in California. This time I saw a sea lion come close to me & my brother & I got scared so I got out of the water. I heard if a sea lion is coming this close to shore that means it's running from something and I did see some finns after it. In 2017 it did report that more sharks were coming close to shore in California. Pretty scary.
Ashley was super personal very attentive and made us feel like we were at home... she makes me want to go to Fred s again

We try and make it annually, we have friends who live right up from the beach.  Each summer we travel down to Kern County for visits with close friends, then just jump on down to the beach via John Wayne airport.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this beach, and love the shopping we do at the Pier as well.  Visually stunning, so WORTH the drive up and along the coast to take in ALL the sights.  We just REALLY enjoy this trip, and look forward to our August return! See you soon!

A MUST DO!  It's known for it's Beautiful Beach & Large Waves & Clear Water. Huntington is also known for its Spectacular Sunsets & if you're lucky enough you might catch their equally Spectacular Moon Risings. What's a moon rising - when the sun is still out but the moon is seen hanging in the sky in daylight. AWESOME!!!
It's great to walk along the beach from 1 end of the beach to the other end. The Over 1 & 1/2 hour walk is beautiful & with a set of headphones & music the time goes by very quickly. Before you know it you've passed the pier and are at 1 end & getting ready to head back in the other direction. This is great for beach goers but especially those who hate to exercise; the scenery makes it easy to do!  
This spot is very popular for Boogie boarders, surfers, kite surfers, & volleyball players & swimmers. This beach has wide white sandy beaches & a separate large path for  bikes, roller skaters, skateboarders & surreys. They even have Fire Pits but you got to get there very early. Parking is $15 but there are meters on the street also.  You can bring your own cooler or there are lots of places to eat across from The Pier & the adjacent Pacific City 
It used to be, you had to have mega bucks & be really rich to have the Good Life, not anymore. The Game has changed. You've been Upgraded. Now You Can 
Live Like a King on a Limited Budget!

Had the pleasure of catching some California sun after returning from a cruise. We happen to stumble upon a surfing competition. It was a really cool expereince. Lot of vendors and you cool vibe. Beach was really clean. The bathrooms were kinda creepy but they were clean. The sink to wash your hands are located on the side of the bayhroom. Plenty of Vollyball nets, places to eat, and get a surfing lesson. I can't wait to go back in a few months!

Well it went from hailing in the morning to this beautiful sunset at Huntington Beach Pier today. The sound & smell of the ocean to the smell of the fire pits, friendly people, people walking their dogs, as so am I. I just came to walk and get some fresh air little did I know I would be treated to such an amazing sunset. Photos taken with my Google Pixel 3XL. Huntington Beach my happy place. Oh and as I mentioned it hailed this morning I was at the beach in shorts & no hoodie!

The Beach belongs to everyone. I also agree with those who want to keep portions of California's beaches private. Inlanders who act like it's their first time at the beach. Kooks in the water. Folks who cannot distinguish between pedestrian and the bike lane. Breakers leaving empty beer cans, liquor bottles, cigarettes, trash. You make the experience less memorable. STAY THE F*CK HOME!

Surf's up this week!
Each wave with it's own exotic design.
The smell of Coppertone in the air..
People everywhere...
Some good.. some not so good...
Some tan, some burnt
Some beyond burnt...
Aroma of BBQ steaks and hot dogs.
A stroll along the beach...
Bicycles, joggers, taxi carts flood the beach

It's the suf's championship week.
Huntington Beach you have changed so dramatically for the better.
First class hotels with a walkway over PCH...
Restaurants galore.... so many to choose from.
When I was a kid...ain't nothing was around.  
We just packed a lunch in an ice chest with sodas and headed for the beach with ma and pa.

One of the better beaches around the LA/OC area. To be more specific, I would say this is one of the better beaches in the LA area.

During the summertime, parking is around $15. You would think with that kind of money, they would maintenance the damn bathrooms located next to Jack's Concession Stand. The bathrooms there....I've never seen it this bad until my recent July 2014 trip. And I've been coming to this beach since the early 2000. One stall had feces all over the toilet seat, another had an old rolled up bikini bottom and one had urine sprayed all over the seat. I kid you not, I cannot make this stuff up. WTF is going on Huntington Beach!?!! Get your ishh straighten'd up!!!  I can't believe how disgusting and inconsiderate some human beings can be. My goodness.

Even though the bathrooms are a complete nightmare, the water and the sand area are still very clean. I didn't see any trash laying around. Everyone seemed to pretty much pick up after themselves (as it should be.). As long as it's clean....I will continue to come to this beach.

Plus on Main St, they have plenty of restaurants and shops there. Perfect for a full day at the beach.

The Sonic in Huntington Beach Needs Management to take Action. I Love the Lemonade slushies and go 3x / wk on Avg. and No Matter what time I go they have the stalls closed requiring Everyone to Have to Use the Drive thru which honestly for a Drink is Crazy the Amount of Time it takes to get thru their line. Hire More Employees or figure out something Bc it's Ashame to Like a plc this Much but to be let down Everytime due to the wait. It's A fast food Establishment. 30 Min for a drink is Out of Control!

We were here for our friend's proposal! They have this really nice area with pretty rocks looking out towards the beach. Pretty for pictures!!! The beach itself is also pretty clean so that's a bonus. They have bike riding area which is cute and romantic. I'll have to come back on my own time and explore a little more. The parking is $15 though which is guess is pretty standard at most beaches. Just make sure you go early so you can spend a lot of time at the there to make it worth it.

I bought a car this past weekend with sales rep Sandra and Kevin, they are both great! Kevin answered all my questions and was very attentive. They were both patient with me as I made my decision on which car to buy. Great experience and I'm loving my RAV4!

- Locale Destination - 
It's on PCH and Main St in Huntington Beach. 

Huntington beach is a lot bigger than its nearby beaches. I like this beach best because it's so easy and convenient (a less hasstle) to do anything unlike nearby beaches - easy to find a parking spot, you can do all kinds of activities here, and laid back and very "California beach" atmosphere.

Parking: You can find a spot (free!) in residential area, though you might need to walk a few blocks during the summer time and on weekends. Lots of meter parking along PCH. City parking by the beach is $15 for the day. The annual parking pass for $200. It's way easier to find a spot than "Newport Beach" and other beaches in the south. 

Surf: Yes. Very territorial locals, so be careful. 
Bike lane: Yes. Good beach biking ;)
Beach volley coats: Lots 
Bathroom: Yes
Showers: Yes
Surfing lesson: Yes (over 5 yrs old)
Rental bikes: Yes
Scuba: No. The water isn't so clear for diving. 
Sea creatures: Dolphins sometimes.
Eateries on beach: Quick grab to "Duke's". 
Events: Lots - US Open (surfing), X-games, July 4th etc. I like their farmer's market on Main St - every Tuesday evening - fresh produce, restaurants, art & craft etc. 
Pier: You can eat at "Ruby's" (at the end of pier). 

Main St: Lots of surf shops, ice cream, big chain restaurants (some small ones), clothing stores, souvenier shops, and cafe. Most foods aren't good here (Welcome to HB ;p - except for "North Shore Poke Co" and "La Rocco's Pizzeria". Both of them are located OFF Main St!!).  




- Conqueror's Deduction - 
This is one of my favorite beaches in OC. You do feel "California"!!
I love this beach and come here so often - just to chill, take pictures, surf etc. It's one of the perks to live in California ;) 

This is one of the beaches you must visit when you're in CA.

*Tourist Approved 

I've been coming to California almost every week for a year and my goal was to see the Pacific Ocean. Finally! I finally stuck my foot in the Cali water three weeks ago (end of May 2017). 

I had the best time here. We went to Fred's across the street. The group had enchiladas and I had some guacamole, chips and a Heineken. After that, it was la playa. Youth Surf Competition was on deck, families, singles, adults, kids, everyone having fun from boogie boarding or volleyball. 

Then, I found my tribe. I wasn't looking for it but there they were. I'm from the East so this was a huge treat for me to look over and see a group forming and hitting djembes and all types of drums. I jumped right in. One of the players (Juan) had two extra drum instruments and he said I could play them so I spent three hours switching between the two drums playing with these great people. From boardwalk dancers to hoola hooping everyone was getting in on this musical interaction. The one local guy said they do this every Sunday. Bystanders were cheering and clapping. It was really nice to find this 3,000 miles away from home. A group of 30-50 fellow drummers. It was majestic.

The best beach in Orange County! 

I have been coming here since I was a kid. In grade school we would take the bus down Beach Blvd. with our boards. I still come here. My favorite spots are the North side of the pier and over by Lifeguard Tower 8. Even if there are no waves, you can almost always find a decent place to body surf between this stretch. 

People here are generally nice on the sand. Just to the north of the pier are where most of the high school and college kids go. It is pretty fun during the summer. But, it can get annoying if there are people in the water that should not be surfing. If you walk two lifeguard towers further North, it is more suitable for families and children. 

The South-side of the pier seems like an endless stretch of sand. It is great for taking long walks to think and meditate and great for running. 

Hawaii does have great beaches and surf. Cancun has awesome sand and water. But, I do not live anywhere near them and this place is always easily accessible. 

I have to say that watching the sunset here during Summer is 5 stars all on its own! 

Well, tomorrow is the 4th. I can tell you a story or two but will refrain. 
Just be prepared for a crowd at the beach if you are here for the 4th of July and an absolute party on the streets. I actually kind of stay away from here on the 4th, as the crowd has a lot of people from other places. Especially in the water I see people swimming with jeans and belts on. Isn't this dangerous? Maybe they even where shoes. I never understood the concept of wearing jeans in the ocean. There are these things called trunks.

Parking is easy. PCH is lined with meters and you can park for a fee by the pier. There is also a great deal of parking on the side streets. 

Newport is nice, but I still prefer HB for the above reasons. There are nice pictures on this board so take a moment to see yourself!

Although, Huntington Beach is a beautiful place to go, it is usually crowded and the only parking spots where vehicles aren't parked at are usually these reserved parking spots and to be honest, the parking issues there since there are little to no parking spots that are opened for non reserved people and whenever someone is trying to park their SUV, it makes it much more challenging for people with a big vehicle to park in a parking spot since there are other vehicles parked between these parking spaces and on Sunday's, it is much worse because it makes it even more of a challenge to get in, especially for someone with a big vehicle like a Chevrolet Suburban or something like that

I won't be back here for a LOOOOONG time.  Never say never, but I'd rather not come back if I have any control over it.

Apparently, there was some corporate party that did the d-bag move of reserving most of the parking at the beach.  As I was driving around to find any sort of parking around the area, I look at the reserved lots and saw that they were empty.  Maybe a handful of cars were in a lot where hundreds of cars could have parked.  This alone actually ended up leading to me making the decision to skip out on my friend's bonfire.  And it wasn't worth the $15 parking fee when they told me this past 7pm.

I'll still give it 3 stars because it's a nice beach.  I just can't recommend it to friends since what I recently experienced is actually possible.

I had my kids bday party today. Off of PCH, pass Brookhurst, & turn left at Magnolia. It was $15 to park and we parked right by bathroom, cafe, and bike rental place. We setup between Lifeguard towers 7 & 8. It worked well because it wasn't too far from our car and there's a partial sidewalk before stepping into deep sand. It was a great spot for an 8th year olds Mermaid Birthday Bash.
We are in the middle of a pandemic and hardly anyone wears a face mask or practicing social distancing.  Bars are open with people sitting shoulder to shoulder.  Quite scary.

Our favorite beach in so cal. Always clean and beautiful. As for the people though be advised that most of them don't seem to be of the mask wearing mindset (even though we're dealing with one of the worst pandemic's ever).

Superb! Love this beach along Pacific Coast Highway. It's pretty clean, not too many weirdos around and although it's loaded with surfers (do to pretty nice waves) there are still plenty of family friendly groups and areas. Everyone seems pretty nice there and I find most people to be respectful of each other's space. Parking is $15 bucks near tower 17 but I like that area. There are plenty of fire pits to use I highly recommend this place.

The best beach in OC! With all the new shopping and dining that has been added within the last few years, Huntington is the place to be! 
Aside from it being Surf City USA, the home to world surf comps and just a surfers paradise in general, Huntington is family friendly and even dog friendly ( way south of the pier) there is no shortage of things to do here. The beach has fire rings which are found off of PCH1 and Twin Dolphin and if you and your family are interested in a game of volley ball well, there are plenty of nets provided too. 
The beach goes on for miles so a walk is always a must. 
My favorite addition to Huntington has to be the Pasa Hotel with its Tanner's Treehouse Lounge this property  is a MUST! The place Gorgeous times 100! But that's an entirely different review....
Anyway, if you find yourself with a day or two, spend the time here, at Huntington Beach. 
So here's a five star " no better beach than this in SoCal" review for Huntington Beach.

Last time I went it was over crowded and full of people not fallowing social distancing guidelines. When I asked a couple who was standing quite close to us if they wouldn't mind moving further away, they shouted obscenities at us. I wouldn't want to go again. Really rude people.

9/30/20 FAT BURGER, Altanta and Beach Blvd, HB. Purchased Med, skinny fries, and coke. Hamburger was over done and cold. Fries while tasty were cold. Store wasn't busy so no need for bad food at $14.98.
I've eaten at other Fat Burgers food was perfect and I enjoyed. I threw this burger away.

Took the kids to Playa Del Ray in July. We ran on the waves, played in the sand and ate till we poppedOn August 1st I went to San Diego with my cousins. We walked on the beach bought souvenirs and bought ice cream before dining at some of the finest restaurants in town.. I plan to go back real soon to visit sea worldz

Love this beach, but then again, being from Chicago, any beach at the ocean is probably going to be fine with me! HB had so much to see and do. A lot of restaurant choices, shopping and entertainment (though many outrageously priced). We loved walking the pier and watching the surfers in the morning and people playing volleyball. We also brought a frisbee, but was so windy while we stayed we never used it. (Feb. 29-Mar. 3). I would definitely stay here again. We loved the Shorebreak Hotel. A great place to stay just steps from the Pier and Main Street.

The beach is super-crowded, scenesters everywhere, and the parking sucks.
The surf is super-crowded, and it's not a great longboard spot anyway.  I'll take San Ono, Anderson St., or even Bolsa over this place any day.
